Belgia 1591 17 Aprill To my L. Trea
s
Belgia: 1591: Ap
r
May it please yo
r
good L. this daie I Rxd her
Hig
nes
l
re
to
e
Generall States
, and an oth
r
to my self, w
ch
was written
by yo
r
L. the 9
th
of this moneth & wholie concerned the affaires
of
Oostend.
The l
re
to
e States I delivered assoone
as yt came to my hand
. And because I found in
e reading
w
ch
was don in my presence in
e Assembly of
e States,
that it was
e answere to a lett
r
w
ch
e
Councell
of late
had sent unto her Ma
ty
, I excused
e erour as well as I
could, & shewed
t
the writer in
e indorsing of
e letter
had mistaken
e States for
e Councell of State, howbeyt
ther was a meeting both of
e States & of
e Councell
to consyder upon
e matter recommended in
e l
re
, wherin they
rest affected, as I have formerly signified, & as yo
r
L.
may
ceave by their answere to her Ma
ty
. They speake
against
e
Gouverno
r
w
th
very much passion, & let mee
saie what I liste, it will nothing p
r
vaile: that I se in
e end they will either be maisters, or take some other
course, that may easely marre all.
Yo
r
L. may rememb
r
that at midsommer last
e
States
of Guelders
made choice of
Count Maurice
, to succeed
e
Count
de Meurs
in
e County of
Zutphen.
The Councel of State,
& likewise
e Count himself let them then understand,
that
e forme of theyr election was against
e 24[
th
]
article of
e Treaty w
th
her Ma
ty
, by w
ch
it is
vided that
in ev
r
y such vacation of a Gouverno
r
, the Province yt self
shall nominate 2 or 3
sons, of w
ch
e Councell of State
shall make election of one. The States of Gueldres th
r
upon,
writ letters of intreaty in Decemb
r
Last, that albeyt their
order of
ceeding was not holy in forme according to
e treaty
yet because Count Maurice was sufficiently qualified, &
e
meetest
son for
e place,
t
yt would please
e councel
in
t
respect, to dispense w
th
e foresaid Article & ratifie
e
election alredy made. It was a matter much debated in
sondry consultations, & as I am
suaded, h
ad b
in quietly
caried against
e meaning of
e Contract, but
t
I opposed
somwhat earnestly against yt. For I urged precisely
e
observation of
e former, alleaging mine othe that bound
mee unto yt, a
ticular charge, by reason of my place, &
the danger of
e consequence, if the Councel should dispense
w
th
any point of
e Treaty, For as it was concluded
by her Ma
ty
, &
e States, so in case of dispensation, w
th
out

Belgia: 1591: Ap
r
To my L. T
re
r A
p
17 1591.
her Hig
nes
assent their actions were frustrate. Wh
r
upon for that
time, there was nothing don in
e election. But as this
daie those of Guelders either finding themselves their
owne error, or admonished frome hence by some of
e Councel
of
have yeelded to
ceed as
e
Councel
Treaty
requireth, & in
a new nomination have joyned
Grave John
of
East Frize
w
th
Count Maurice. Howbeyt the oth
r
being named but
for forme
e Election of this Councel is past upon Count
Maurice.
Having no other mater to advertise yo
r
L. I take my h
u
ble leave. Hage A
p
17 1591.
